data.title: Reverse Shot
data.meta_description: Museum of the Moving Image presents Reverse Shot: a different angle on moving images—past, present, and future
data.text:
Farihah Zaman

Farihah Zaman is a Brooklyn-based filmmaker, critic, and programmer. In addition to Reverse Shot, she has written for Filmmaker Magazine, Huffington Post, and the AV Club, among others. Her films include the award winning documentary Remote Area Medical, the short Kombit, (2014 Sundance Film Festival), the feature This Time Next Year (2014 Tribeca Film Festival), and the feature Feast of the Epiphany (2018). Her diverse background in the film industry includes working as the Acquisitions Manager at indie distribution company Magnolia Pictures, and serving as the the Program Manager of The Flaherty Seminar, organizing their historic, contentious annual event and launching a monthly screening series at Anthology Film Archives.
